alert.note: Alert for Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 6:03AM EST by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Collier County through 645 AM EST... At 603 AM EST, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud 8 miles east of Copeland, or 14 miles northeast of Everglades City, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Big Cypress National Preserve. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
